#Text=How to Make Skittles Vodka
#Text=Three Methods : Single Serving ( 25 mL Shot )
#Text=Bottles of " Skittled "

column1: #Text=Vodka Dishwasher Bottle Method
#Text=Making Skittles vodka is a fun way to add a splash of fruity flavor and color to regular vodka .
#Text=All you need to do is place your favorite combination of Skittles candies into a glass or bottle of vodka and wait for it to infuse .
#Text=You can then use your Skittles vodka to make brightly-colored cocktails or even serve it as a sugary shot !
#Text=Find multiple methods for making Skittles vodka after the jump -- and soon you 'll be tasting the rainbow !
#Text=Ingredient
#Text=A handle ( 1.75 liters , about a half gallon ) of vodka per bag of Skittles
#Text=A large bag of Skittles candy ( the " movie size " bag )
#Text=Method 1 of 3 : Single Serving ( 25 mL Shot )
#Text=Separate the colors of Skittles that you want to flavor the vodka with .

#Text=Many people choose to leave out the green , which is lime if you 're using original Skittles , and purple , which is grape in the original style , as they can create a weird taste combination or a less than appealing color for the final product .
#Text=However , you can put them in if you want .
#Text=If you do n't mind mixed flavors , you can just skip this step altogether .
#Text=Add six Skittles to 25 ml of vodka .
#Text=Keep swirling the mixture until the Skittles are almost completely dissolved .
#Text=Note that the ratio of Skittles to vodka varies from recipe to recipe .
#Text=You should experiment to find your preferred mix before making larger bottles .
#Text=Filter out the remaining Skittle " insides " .
#Text=With single servings like this , you can decide which flavor(s) you like best and proceed to making bottles , if you desire .
#Text=Method 2 of 3 : Bottles of " Skittled " Vodka
#Text=Pour out some vodka from a bottle to make room for Skittles .
#Text=Separate the Skittles by color .
#Text=Add the Skittles ( 20 - 25 per 350 ml / 11.8 fl oz ) .
#Text=Let the mixture sit for a day or two .
#Text=Shake occasionally so the flavour mixes well .
#Text=Strain out the Skittles using a filter , such as a paper coffee filter or a clean t-shirt .
#Text=Refrigerate overnight .
#Text=Method 3 of 3 : Dishwasher Bottle Method
#Text=Separate the colors from five bags of 200 g Skittles .
#Text=Using 5 x 700 ml / 23.6 fl oz bottles , pour 300 ml / 10.1 fl oz of vodka into a jug and fill each bottle with skittles .
#Text=Place the bottles in your dishwasher and put on an intensive cycle .
#Text=One third of of the way through the cycle , shake all bottles vigorously .
#Text=Two thirds of the way through the cycle , shake all bottles vigorously .
#Text=Once the cycle has finished , shake all bottles vigorously again .
#Text=Then place in the freezer for 2 hours .
#Text=Once the vodka is cold , it should be syrupy .
#Text=Take a sieve , line it with a piece of cheesecloth ( muslin ) or a coffee filter , place above a large jug and pour the vodka through slowly .
#Text=Once the first bottle has been filtered , wash out the bottle and pour the Skittles vodka back in .
#Text=Repeat the above two steps for all bottles , ensuring that everything is cleaned between uses to prevent color contamination .
#Text=Place all of the bottles in the freezer until you are ready to drink .
#Text=Do n't worry , the vodka wo n't freeze .
#Text=You are finished .
#Text=Enjoy your tasty creation .
#Text=Tips .
#Text=If you want to make it more quickly , cut the skittles in half before putting them into vodka .
#Text=Shake every 15 minutes .
#Text=They 'll dissolve in an hour instead of a day .
#Text=Or you could just scoop them out when the color dissolves .
#Text=Start with small amount of vodka and Skittles at first to experiment which combination of taste suits you best .
#Text=You can carry this out with larger amount of vodka and Skittles once you have decided that you enjoy the taste .
#Text=The lime green Skittles add a sourness to the drink , so if you want one that 's sweet , leave the green ones out and add them to their own bottle for a sour lime vodka .
#Text=Another approach is to buy five bottles of vodka and five bags of Skittles .
#Text=Then separate the candy and use one flavor for each bottle .
#Text=( Or get four bottles and an empty , to allow room for the skittles . )
#Text=If using a t-shirt to strain , be sure fabric softener or a dryer sheet had not been used with it , lets you get some extra ( unwanted ) flavoring ( and potentially toxic chemicals ) .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Drink responsibly .
#Text=Never drink and drive .
#Text=Know your limits , and do not drink to the extent of intoxication .
#Text=Do not drink if underage in your country .
#Text=Things You 'll Need

#Text=Each handle of vodka ( 1.75 liters , about a half gallon ) requires a large bag worth of Skittles , so if you plan on doing only one flavor for a flavorful vodka , you 'll have to buy 5 large bags of Skittles .
#Text=Coffee filter , cheesecloth / muslin , or an extremely clean T-shirt
#Text=Large funnel or strainer to hold filter
